recipeIngredient: 6 to 8 oz Rotini or Fusilli pasta
1 to 1.5 tsp fresh thyme leaves  (or 1/2 tsp dried thyme)
3/4 cup pumpkin puree or use sweet potato puree
3/4 to 1 cup non dairy milk like coconut or almond
2 to 3 Tbsp breadcrumbs ( or coarsely ground cashews or pumpkin seeds)
a generous pinch of salt and pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the pasta according to instructions. Drain and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the pasta according to instructions. Drain and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large skillet, heat oil at medium low heat. Add Sage, thyme and garlic and cook until garlic and herbs change color slightly. Stir frequently to avoid burning. At this point you can add in veggies or mushrooms and cook until golden.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large skillet, heat oil at medium low heat. Add Sage, thyme and garlic and cook until garlic and herbs change color slightly. Stir frequently to avoid burning. At this point you can add in veggies or mushrooms and cook until golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Add tomato paste and pumpkin and mix in. Add milk, salt and pepper and mix in. Bring to a boil. Taste and adjust salt.
recipeInstructions.name: Add tomato paste and pumpkin and mix in. Add milk, salt and pepper and mix in. Bring to a boil. Taste and adjust salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Add cooked pasta, toss well. Cover and take off heat. Let sit for a few minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cooked pasta, toss well. Cover and take off heat. Let sit for a few minutes.

itemListElement.text: In a small skillet, add oil and heat at medium. Add sage and cook for half a minute. Add breadcrumbs or coarsely chopped nuts and cook until golden and toasted. Add salt and pepper and mix in. Use to garnish the pasta generously. You can also sprinkle some pepita parm or other nut based parm.
